  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A LEAKER WAS CALLED OUT ON THE SORT AISLE DOOR 57. THE RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE PACKAGE AND FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE. THE CONTAINER WAS MADE OF PLASTIC. THE REST OF THE CONTAINER EMPTIED AND PROCESSED IN THE DMP.THE DECISION TREE AND PROPER RESPONSE SHEET WERE USED IN THIS PROCESS

item.title: Report X-2024100681
item.description:
Report X-2024100681

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN FREMONT, CALIFORNIA, ONE AIR PACKAGE TO MALAYSIA WAS BEING INSPECTED PRIOR TO EXPORT. THE OUTER BOX IS ULINE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PACKAGING WITH FOUR OSHA NFPA LABELS APPLIED INDICATING FLAMMABILITY HAZARD 1, HEALTH HAZARD 2 AND INSTABILITY HAZARD 0. PACKAGE CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS A FIVE GALLON 1A1 STEEL DRUM OF FLAMMABLE SHELL D-38, MINERAL SPIRITS 66.1% AROM. THE OSHA NFPA LABEL ON THE STEEL DRUM INDICATES FLAMMABILITY HAZARD 2 WITH A FLASH POINT RANGE OF 104 - 115 F, WHICH IS REGULATED IN AIR TRANSPORTATION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 279E20, KEVIN ZHU, 35675 CHAPLIN DR, FREMONT CA 94536-2525.

item.title: Report X-2024100526
item.description:
Report X-2024100526

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-08
  • City: LONG BEACH
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3100
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TIFU 126964 was reported releasing a steady amount of gasoline. United Pumping was dispatched to the container to assess and remediate. United Pumping reported the valve was damaged when it was set on the chassis by a cap that was not installed on the valve dangling from the securement cable. The cap became caught between the valve and the frame of the chassis causing damage to the flange bolts. The container was lifted off of the chassis and the obstruction was removed. The bolts were able to be tightened stopping the release.

item.title: Report X-2024100525
item.description:
Report X-2024100525

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: French Camp
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4510
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EMHU 650889 was reported leaking a white liquid. Graymar Environmental was sent to evaluate and remediate the reported spill. They found two drums of UN1210 leaking from the bottom seams. No apparent drum damage was found. leak is determined to be the failure of basic material
